Package com.github.anastaciocintra.escpos.image

Class Bitonal

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.anastaciocintra.escpos.image.Bitonal
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BitonalOrderedDither, BitonalThreshold
    public abstract class Bitonal
extends Object
    Abstract base for algorithms that transform RGB to bitonal.

    Used on EscPosImage constructor. Any dither algorithm can be implemented, like ordered grid or noise dither. Generally, you need to call image.getRGB(x, y) and decide if return zero or one. you need to Override only the zeroOrOne method but if you want, you can Override getBitonalVal(CoffeeImage, int, int) getBitonalVal} too.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bitonal

    • Method Detail

      • getBitonalVal

        public int getBitonalVal​(CoffeeImage image,
                         int x,
                         int y)
        Pre-work each coordinate (x, y) of image by discover RGBA values. get the 8-bits values separated by alpha, red, blue and green and return by calling zeroOrOne(int, int, int, int, int, int) to make print or not decision.
        Parameters:
        image - RGB image.
        x - the X coordinate of the pixel from which to get the pixel
        y - the Y coordinate of the pixel from which to get the pixel
        Returns:
        call zeroOrOne to make decision (0 or 1)
        See Also:
        zeroOrOne(int, int, int, int, int, int)

      • zeroOrOne

        public abstract int zeroOrOne​(int alpha,
                              int red,
                              int green,
                              int blue,
                              int x,
                              int y)
        Subclasses need to translate the 8-bits RGBA colors to 0 or 1 (print or not)

        for any coordinate x, y of the BufferedImage.

        Parameters:
        alpha - range from 0 to 255
        red - range from 0 to 255
        green - range from 0 to 255
        blue - range from 0 to 255
        x - the X coordinate of the image
        y - the Y coordinate of the image
        Returns:
        0 or 1
